title: Kapiti Island
description: Predator-free sanctuary with native wildlife, walking trails, and stunning views — the journey with the boat is an adventure in itself. Beware of the cheeky weka and kaka birds!

ratingNegative.text: i went there and was instantly jumped by a hoard of angry seals
ratingNegative.author: Matheo Sharp

ratingPositive.text: It is a nice looking island I love it when you are playing in the sand 😀😉 Go to beach now.have a great stay.!
ratingPositive.author: Josh Humphreys

title: Blue Penguins Pukekura
description: Watch the world's smallest penguins return to shore at dusk in; this is an almost guaranteed sighting. Pro tip: Do not run to the front of the viewing platform, as the penguins will walk by on the left, giving you a much better and longer view.

ratingNegative.text: They restrict the access to the beach. Not possible to see without a tour. Tourist trap!
ratingNegative.author: Mikhail Grevtsov

ratingPositive.text: They’re impossibly cute, like tiny plush toys come to life, and you can often hear them under the platform you’re standing on even if you can’t see them.
ratingPositive.author: Luthien E.
